properties.name: Adam Burke
properties.description: Posted by Airtestnew yorkI\'ve been gathering multi media material on radio story assignments for several years now (photos, video). In the coming months, I plan to start blogging and sharing audio/visual stories online, and this workshop will help me navigate the sea of tools and formats available.It\'s clear that social media is happpening and I want to learn more. And I love being a part of AIR and AIR-related activities.

properties.name: Adi Gevins
properties.description: Posted by AirtestBryn Mawr, PAI do what I do in order to provide a voice to the voiceless. I am expert at radio broadcast media. I have substantial experience in trying to utilize new media. I am dedicated to helping community groups, artists and alternative media to reach new audiences through new media. It would be a great benefit to participate in this day.

properties.name: Alix Blair
properties.description: Posted by AirtestDURHAMI consider myself an independent producer-- not a beginner, but not yet with the solid foundation in audio story-making as I would like. I\'m an instructor with the Center for Documentary Studies\' audio institutes and being a teacher has actually made me a better student in my own learning. I see there is so much to keep learning and my head is wide open. I went to the Deep Wireless conference in Toronto and it absolutely stretched my creative thinking of what is possible. I am very drawn to the description of this day workshop (and I am attending Third Coast).

properties.name: Catie Talarski
properties.description: Posted by AirtesthartfordSince Where We Live began two years ago ö our goal has been to expand our audience, make connections, and involve our community. Weâve dabbled in Myspace, Facebook, and Flickr. We take emails and comments on the website ö and most of our shows include local vox montages. But in the end, I feel like thereâs a world of people weâre not reaching. The greatest thing I could get out of this workshop would be to understand how to get more (diverse!) people interested and involved in our conversations ö to help generate content, provide ideas and cultivate a ãsense of placeä.

properties.name: David Goren
properties.description: Posted by AirtestBROOKLYNI\'m interested in learning more about how to use social media to nurture an audience for my work. I use social media such as facebook, but as an official old codger admit that I don\'t quite get it. So, I\'m hoping to deepen my understanding of what it is.

properties.name: David Polk
properties.description: Posted by AirtestchicagoI\'m experimenting with social media every day for my radio show, which is geared towards high school students. We have our own network on ning: http://www.wfmtintroductions.com, Facbook page, and Myspace page. This workshop is perfect for what I\'m trying to do and I\'d love to hear about other peoples\' experiences.

properties.name: Devin Browne
properties.description: Posted by Airtestlos angelesall freelancers are their own pr people. so like everyone else in the business of self promotion, i\'d like to know how to get as many listeners, subscribers, viewers, visitors possible to my (not yet up) blog and my (also not quite up yet) website with a radio and print portfolio. i\'m blogging about my neighborhood, the ellis island of LA and the fake ID capital of the US. not a single other reporter in los angeles is covering it, but since i live here, take the bus here, buy tamales here, get solicited for prostitution here, used to teach first grade here, i\'ve decided i\'m as appropriate as anyone to create its seminal site of neighborly news. next steps & wonderings: how to create a neighborhood blog with an engaged listener base when almost no one in the neighborhood owns their own computer and really almost no one in the neighborhood speaks english? how multi-media intensive should the blog be. how polished. should i write like a trained reporter or is this a good place to more experiment in my own style and voice. how to collaborate with photographers & illustrators & graphic artists when i anticipate a long stretch before the blog has underwriters. how to cover macarthur park for kpfk in their style, according to their code & then... supplement it to fit the voice of the blog? leave it alone? i don\'t know. does the blog need a presence on facebook, flickr, youtube, linkedin, and every other possible social networking site or is ok to just choose one? how to be resident & blogger-reporter all at once. how to share it. how to be a good community member in the world of bloggers. and anything else you might teach.

properties.name: Fereshteh Toosi
properties.description: Posted by AirtestsyracuseMy current sound walk project is based on interviews about a specific place, providing a great opportunity to connect people who have shared memories about this landscape. I\'d like to keep my interviewees informed and connected to one another during the course of what is a long-term production schedule. This has happened through events like potlucks, but Iâd like to take advantage of social media more. Is this possible with senior citizens? I have been keeping a blog and trying to distribute some samples via podcast, but I could approach these tools with more wisdom. Mostly, I am interested in how to use social media to make the project relevant to a larger audience beyond the local one that Iâm targeting in Central NY.

properties.name: Ginna Allison
properties.description: Posted by Airtestdallas I\'ve been hungry for hands-on learning about how to use social media in the sites I work on, how to make it most effective, and when it\'s NOT valuable. Want to learn more about citizen journalism.

properties.name: Jennifer Guerra
properties.description: Posted by AirtestFordham, NY I\'m a big fan of civic engagement. I think it\'s what keeps public radio relevant. Getting local people to share stories that are important to them -- and using social media to do that. I\'m also interested in having my station use the web as a sort of local pitch room -- where we\'d post a monthly topic and have listeners pitch stories. We\'d choose one pitch per month, work on it with the listener, and eventually air it. Hopefully at the seminar I can get some ideas about how to go about something like this!

properties.name: Jenny Lawton
properties.description: Posted by Airtestnew yorkStudio 360 has a goal of being ãmore interactiveä with our listeners ö but we donât know how. While weâre partially hamstrung by the limited tools our station offers us, I know there are lots of free services that we could harness effectively and immediately. Iâm eager to learn how. Moreover, as a radio maker, I realize the platforms from which we reach our audience are changing. For my showâs survival (and my own!), itâs critical to integrate this new way of thinking/producing now, or weâll soon be obsolete. I want to learn how to communicate that to my team.

properties.name: Joanna Greer
properties.description: Posted by AirtestatlantaI want to train my students to tell their stories via radio (and mine, too, I suppose). I teach in an urban school with a large FARM rate and as the new media academy head, I want to saturate their world with ways show the outside world who they are and their perceptions. I am not going to lie . . . I want to see what you guys know to save myself time and to get this program launched. Teachers don\'t have much time. So, bottom line is I love radio. I love stories. I love my students. They have much to teach us.

properties.name: Julie Caine
properties.description: Posted by Airtestsan franciscoAn as independent producer, I want my work not only to reach as many people as possible, but also for as many people as possible to reach me. I know that social media is one strong avenue for this kind of larger collaborative effort, and I just simply don\'t have the fluency I need to navigate and use the technology very effectively. In my capacity with SoundVision Productions, I\'m working hard to help them develop a vibrant, multi-platform presence online that involves and reaches a wide audience, and this workshop will be invaluable for us.

properties.name: Karen Michel
properties.description: Posted by AirtestpoughkeepsieI know bupkus about social networking. I do know that "standard" radio is not the only way to get stories out there by far. As a teacher (Marist College) I\'m hampered by knowing less than my students about social networking. I should be able to teach/guide them how to use these tools, but I urgently need guidance myself!

properties.name: Kristin Suratt
properties.description: Posted by AirtestUkiahI am brand new to this sort of thing. I read the tech pages of the chronicle, and love the idea of progressing into the tech world, however, I\'ve been a bit of a vidiot, and I want to change my ways by working with dynamic, intelligent on top of it people who do know what they are doing. I am willing to learn.

properties.name: Lisa Morehouse
properties.description: Posted by Airtestsan franciscoAs a 12-year veteran public high school teacher, I\'m great at networking face-to-face to get things done (I\'m sitting with a fellow AIR member right now, filling this out!). But I haven\'t used social networking yet to find sources or get my work out. I love how radio has the potential to both keep up with and push the uses of new technology, and I want to be a part of that. I\'ve just joined PRX and want to jump into the social networking pool, and think this intensive could push my work forward.
